tweet: I urge every senator to support our bipartisan resolution terminating the president‚Äôs unlawful national emergency declaration. We must uphold our oath to protect the Constitution‚Äî no matter which party we‚Äôre in. pic.twitter.com/04bQMtcpjG

Let‚Äôs be clear: voting down this power grab isn‚Äôt about where you stand on the wall. It‚Äôs about where you stand on the Constitution. We have to stand up to this blatant attempt to raid critical defense dollars for a pet project. We need to end this phony national emergency.
When we were sworn into Congress, we didn‚Äôt swear an oath to one party or person. We swore an oath to uphold the Constitution. And that‚Äôs why we need to vote to end this emergency declaration.

This isn‚Äôt a political issue. 
 
The president's emergency declaration is testing whether we're going to lie down and set this dangerous precedent‚Äî where any president can raid taxpayer money without the consent of Congress. 
 
We can't go down that path.

I've introduced a bipartisan resolution with @SenatorCollins, @SenatorShaheen, and @lisamurkowski to END the president's unconstitutional national emergency declaration.
